title: Disabled form controls and how to tackle them
partialText: Find out how to use the HTML disabled boolean attribute, toggle it with JavaScript and style disabled form controls.

title: HTML replaced and void elements
partialText: Learn more about the HTML replaced and void elements and visualize the intersection of these two HTML elements sets using a Venn diagram.

title: Light and dark themed SVG favicon using the CSS prefers-color-scheme media feature
partialText: How to use an SVG as a favicon for your website, considering the light and dark theme detection in the browser using the CSS prefers-color-scheme media feature, with PNG and ICO fallbacks.

title: The current DOM node in browserâ€™s console
partialText: Find out how to get the current DOM node, React and Vue.js components or current Angular scope in order to speed up debugging in the browser console.

title: How to copy to the clipboard using JS and the Clipboard API
partialText: Find out how to copy to the clipboard using JS and the modern asynchronous Clipboard API.

title: CSS resize none on textarea is bad for UX
partialText: Some people decide to remove the textarea resize handle using the CSS resize none declaration and that is a bad thing for UX.

title: An SEO story on the website name from the Google SERP
partialText: I didn't add a website name within the title tag for my website, then I switched to a new domain and Google was showing my old website name references in the SERP.

title: Fancy new selectors within groups can break your CSS rule
partialText: Fancy new selectors within groups can break your CSS rule if just one of these selectors is invalid or if the browser doesn't recognize it.

title: The 3-in-1 full-stack developer
partialText: The 3-in-1 full-stack developer wording is weird, at least.

title: SVG icon system within Pug/Jade
partialText: How to include a minified, production-ready SVG icon system, using symbols within the Pug/Jade pages.
